trs: Who is building a house?
What will the son eat?
How many children (lit. son daughter) do you have?
Why should we take the body to the village?
How could we extinguish the fire that was burning?
Where (lit: in which place) will that thing appear?
The men of which village danced?
Who did that man hit?
Who hit that man?
Who hit that man?
Who hit them (so that) they ran away?
At what time did they say to go?
Who (woman) came at what time?
Which man took/married which woman?
(I wonder) what will happen to me because father scolded me?
Didn't you see that?
You?
Is that thing good?
Did you see my wife or not?

imt: that1  liver  push-Np-\textsc{pr}.2p=\textsc{qm}  or  liver  stuck-\textsc{inch}-\textsc{pa}-2p
trs: Do you remember (lit: push the liver) that, or have you forgotten (lit: liver is stuck) it?
Will you go to Matukar, Dylup, or Sarang?
Will you go to Matukar or Dylup (or perhaps neither)?
Did you light a fire or did you feel (that there was) a man?
Did they bring food, or what?
He was watching whether it would rot or what would happen.
He didn't go, did he?

imt: A:elder.sibling  Goroka  go-Np-\textsc{fu}.3p  -  B:  Goroka  go-Np-\textsc{fu}.3p=\textsc{qm}
src: A:Paapa  Goroka  ikiw-i-non.  -  B:  Gor\'oka  ikiw-i-non=i?
trs: A: Big brother is going to Goroka. B: Is he going to \textstyleEmphasizedWords{{Goroka}}?
Who did he tell?
Who did he tell???
Are you asking who he told?

imt: A:  that1  good=\textsc{cf}.\textsc{qm}  B:  that1  good=\textsc{cf}.\textsc{qm}  say-\textsc{pa}-2s=\textsc{qm}
src: A:  Nain  eliwa=ki?  B:  Nain  eliwa-ki  \textstyleEmphasizedVernacularWords{ma-e-n=i}?
trs: A: Is that good?  B: Did you ask if that is good?

imt: 2p.\textsc{unm}  liver  big  thus  1s.\textsc{acc}  put-Np-\textsc{pr}.2p=\textsc{qm}  1s.\textsc{unm}  well  2p.\textsc{acc}  heal-Np-\textsc{fu}.1s  thus=\textsc{qm}
src: Ni  kema  maneka  naap  efa  wu-i-man=i, yo  eliw  nia  saliw-i-nen,  \textstyleEmphasizedVernacularWords{naap=i}?
trs: Do you believe about me that I can heal you, is that so?
He asked me what I saw.
I don't know how much they put.
Where would we have that kind of money to give you? (=We do not have money to give you.)
Will I be with you forever? (= I will not.)
Why are you crying like that? (=You should not cry like that.)
Who told you to come? (=You shouldn't have come)

src: Aa  muuka,  no  moram  naap  yia  on-a-n?
trs: Oh son, why did you do this to us?

imt: 1s.\textsc{unm}  rat  small  valley  descend-\textsc{pa}-3s  that1  see-\textsc{pa}-2p=\textsc{qm}
src: Yo  seewa  gelemuta  uruma  or-o-k  nain  uruf-a-man=i?
trs: Have you seen my ``little rat'' (pig) that went down to the valley? (implying: I have no doubt that you have stolen my pig.)

imt: sun  three=\textsc{loc}  work-\textsc{nmz}  finish-2/3s.\textsc{ds}  thing  what  do-\textsc{pa}-2p
src: {\ob}Ama  arow=pa  mauw-owa  weeser-eya{\cb}  maa  mauwa  on-a-man?
trs: After your work finished at three, what did you do?

src: {\ob}Yo  oram  nefa  nokar-i-yem{\cb},  soomia=ko  efar uruf-a-n=i?
trs: I'm just asking: have you seen my spoon?

imt: always  big  quickly  not  ascend-Np-\textsc{pr}.2s  that1  why
src: Anane  maneka  ewur  me  urup-i-n  nain  moram?
trs: What is the reason why you never come up quickly?
Are you going to town tomorrow?
Yes.
(Yes,) I am going.
(No,) I am not going.
(Yes,) I'll go to town tomorrow.
What kind of food did you eat?
(We ate) the white people's food.
What did your nephew do to you?

src: \textstyleEmphasizedVernacularWords{Weetak},  yo  mauw-a-m  ne  o  me  efa  uruf-a-k.
trs: I worked but he did not even look at me.' (Implying: Your presupposition is wrong; he did not do anything indecent to me.)

src: O  aakun-owa  marew=yon.  -\textstyleEmphasizedVernacularWords{Wia},  aakun-owa  wiar  ik-ua.
trs: Perhaps he doesn't have anything to say. --No, he \textstyleEmphasizedWords{{does}} have something to say.
Didn't father come? --Yes (he \textstyleEmphasizedWords{{did}}).
Didn't father come? --No (he didn't).
Run(pl.) to Medebur, flee.
Fool, don't say like that.
Stop crying, \textstyleEmphasizedWords{{please}}!

imt: 2s.\textsc{unm}  talk  turtle  get-\textsc{pa}-3s  that1  tell-2/3s.\textsc{ds} 1p.\textsc{unm}  hear-Np-\textsc{fu}.1p
src: No  opaimika  pon  aaw-o-n  nain  \textstyleEmphasizedVernacularWords{ma-eya} i  miim-i-yen.
trs: Tell us about your catching a turtle, and we'll listen.' (Or: `You will tell us about your catching a turtle and we'll listen.')
Bring it!

imt: woman  garden  go-\textsc{ss}.\textsc{seq}  eat-\textsc{nmz}  search-\textsc{ss}.\textsc{seq}  descend-\textsc{imp}.2p
trs: Women, go to the garden, look for food and come down.
Tell the people and let them not eat me.
Having been here with him (=your brother), go up to your husband again.
Alright, let's go down to the village.
Let's go and see them.
Let her not talk to her brothers.
Let her keep going with her husband, seeing him (= her father) and coming back.
Keep doing like that.
Now do that.
Don't have/keep your eyes closed.
Don't lie!
Say like that and wail.
